intro: Hieracium eurotion, commonly known as the European wood hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium eurotion is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
